content.raw:
I agree with Steve - `resolveTo` should by default resolve to the parent XML element. We perhaps did not capture this explicitly, but I think the default behavior should reflect the current behavior that is reflected in the current kinematics tutorials:

[http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=spec\_model\_kinematics&cat=specification&](http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=spec_model_kinematics&cat=specification&)

If I understand this fully, if `resolveTo`'s target frame were to resolve by default to `@relative_to`, then we’re really just encoding the same behavior as the deprecated `Pose()` / the new `RawPose()` functionality, which I think would hurt in terms of adhering to the specification.  \(`libsdformat`s default behavior should encourage sticking to the specification as much as possible.\)
